title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 325-4.4 - Inspections and investigations by the department of health
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 325-4.4 - Inspections and investigations by the department of health

State Regulations
(a) The Department
of Health shall have 180 days from the chairman's request for an inspection and
investigation pursuant to subdivision 4(g)(i) of section
13-c
of the Workers' Compensation Law, in which to refer its report and
recommendations to the chairman. (b) The Department of Health shall send
notice to the chairman of all decisions rendered in any enforcement action
commenced by the Department of Health against an authorized hospital or health
maintenance organization with respect to its out-patient medical care and
facilities. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
325-4.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
